channel.title: CNN: World
channel.description: Real time updated news from the first worldwide TV channel specialized in world information (By http://www.newsisfree.com/syndicate.php - FOR PERSONAL AND NON COMMERCIAL USE ONLY!)

item.title: Death toll hits 20 in Kashmir protests
item.description: Violent protests continued across Kashmir Wednesday, as the death toll from the past two days of demonstrations rose to 20, a senior police official said.

item.title: Austrian incest victims surprise police
item.description: Read full story for latest details.

item.title: 3 aid workers killed in Afghan attack
item.description: Gunmen shot and killed three international aid workers and their driver in an ambush on their convoy in a province south of Kabul Wednesday, authorities said.

item.title: New vote piles pressure on Musharraf to quit
item.description: The third of Pakistan's four provincial assemblies passed a resolution Wednesday calling for Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf to step down or face impeachment.

item.title: Reports: 50 Russian tanks in Georgian city
item.description: Dozens of Russian tanks entered the strategic Georgian city of Gori Wednesday about eight hours after the country accepted a cease-fire, according to reports.

item.title: Nine dead in Tripoli explosion
item.description: An explosion targeting a bus rocked a business district in central Tripoli Wednesday morning, killing at least six people and wounding four others, Lebanese internal security forces told CNN.

item.title: Mexico announces anti-kidnapping reforms
item.description: Read full story for latest details.

item.title: Tribunal indicts Khmer Rouge jailer
item.description: Read full story for latest details.

item.title: Use of contractors in Iraq 'unprecedented'
item.description: The United States spent $85 billion on contracts in Iraq and other countries in the first four years of the war and is relying on contract employees at a greater rate than in any other war, according to a government report released Tuesday.

item.title: Tsvangirai denies exclusion from Zimbabwe deal
item.description: Embattled Zimbabwean President Robert Mugabe signed a deal to form a unity government with a breakaway faction of the country's opposition party -- a deal that doesn't involve the opposition leader -- an official with Mugabe's party said.
